content: Please note that the editors will be unavailable during the upgrade. We also recommend to <1>backup your data</1> before you start.

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a notification about editor unavailability during an upgrade process, advising users to backup their data. It appears in UI components related to official documentation and possibly other places where system updates are communicated.

usage.context: Please note that the editors will be unavailable during the upgrade. We also recommend to

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The tag <1> is not properly closed in the Arabic translation. It should be </1> consistently.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure the tag <1> is closed with </1> in the Arabic translation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are present in both the English and Azerbaijani versions, but they don't seem to serve a specific purpose. While not technically incorrect, they are unusual and might disrupt the display.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the HTML tags <1> and </1> unless they are essential for specific formatting requirements.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags `<1>` are present in both the English and Bulgarian versions. While they indicate a specific element, they should be removed if they are purely for translation purposes and don't serve a functional purpose in the UI.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the `<1>` tags from the Bulgarian translation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The formatting tags (<1>backup your data</1>) are inconsistent between the English and Czech versions. The English uses <1> while the Czech uses <1>.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent formatting tags. Consider using <1>zálohovali svá data</1> to match the English <1>backup your data</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets `<1>` used for marking the backup phrase are inconsistent between the English and German versions. In English it is `<1>backup your data</1>` and in German it is `<1>Backup Ihrer Daten</1>`. This is a formatting inconsistency.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent use of angle brackets for marked content across languages.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'We also recommend to' is not accurately translated.  'Wir empfehlen auch, dass Sie' is overly formal and a bit clumsy. A more natural translation would be 'Wir empfehlen außerdem' or 'Wir empfehlen Ihnen außerdem'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace 'Wir empfehlen auch, dass Sie' with 'Wir empfehlen außerdem' or 'Wir empfehlen Ihnen außerdem'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The construction 'dass Sie ein Backup Ihrer Daten zuvor machen' is grammatically awkward. 'zuvor' (before) is placed unconventionally. A better placement would be before 'machen'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change 'dass Sie ein Backup Ihrer Daten zuvor machen' to 'dass Sie vorher ein Backup Ihrer Daten machen'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tag <1> is present in both the English and Greek text. While maintaining consistency is good, it might not be necessary and could be removed for clarity depending on the platform's rendering.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the <1> and </1> tags if they are not required for rendering.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are present in both the English and Finnish text. While this is consistent, it's unclear why they are there and whether they should be preserved or removed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Investigate the purpose of the HTML tags and determine whether to keep them or remove them. If they are intended for formatting, ensure consistency across all locales. If they are not necessary, remove them.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The `<1>...</1>` tags are present in both the English and Armenian content, but the formatting seems to indicate emphasis. It's important to ensure the formatting is consistently applied and serves the intended purpose.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Verify if the emphasis is intentional. If so, ensure consistent formatting throughout all translations. If not, remove the tags.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags `<1>backup your data</1>` in the English content are not accurately reflected in the Japanese translation's HTML tags. The Japanese uses `<1>データのバックアップ</1>` while the English uses `backup your data`. This breaks the intended HTML highlighting.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider aligning the HTML tags to match the English: `<1>データのバックアップ</1>

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The formatting tags (<1>backup your data</1>) are present in both the English and Korean versions, and they should be consistent. However, the HTML tags are slightly different (<1> vs. <1>).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent HTML tag format: Use either <1>backup your data</1> or <1>데이터를 백업</1> consistently.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tag <1> is not properly closed in the Lao translation. It should be </1> to match the English.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change '</1> to </1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The formatting tags <1>backup your data</1> in the English content are not accurately reflected in the Latvian translation's formatting tags <1>dublēt datus</1>. The English tag uses 'backup' while the Latvian uses 'dublēt'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure the formatting tags align with the content they highlight. If 'backup' is a special term needing highlighting, ensure the Latvian translation uses a corresponding term and tag.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are inconsistent between the English and Dutch versions. The English version uses '<1>backup your data</1>' and the Dutch version uses '<1>een back-up van uw gegevens</1>'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Maintain consistency in HTML tag usage. Consider using either '<1>backup your data</1>' or '<1>een back-up van uw gegevens</1>' throughout.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags `<1>` and `</1>` are inconsistent between the English and Polish versions. The English version uses `<1>` and `</1>`, while the Polish uses `<1>` and `</1>`. This might cause rendering issues.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent HTML tag formatting.  Choose either `<1>` and `</1>` or `<1>` and `</1>` and apply consistently across all translations.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tag `<1>` is not consistently applied. It starts and ends at different content in the English and Romanian versions.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure the HTML tag `<1>` consistently encloses the same content in both languages. In this case, it should enclose "să creați o copie de rezervă".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The tag `<1>` is present in both the English and Russian content. It should be checked to ensure consistency and proper rendering on the platform.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Confirm that the `<1>` tag is rendered correctly and consistently across both languages. If it's for highlighting or a specific style, ensure that the style is also localized.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "recommend to backup your data" is not accurately translated. The Sinhala translation 'ඔබගේ දත්ත උපස්ථයක් තැබීමට නිර්දේශ කෙරේ' literally translates to 'recommends to place a backup of your data'. A more natural translation would be something like 'ඔබගේ දත්ත පිටපත් කිරීමට අපි නිර්දේශ කරමු' (we recommend copying your data).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ඔබගේ දත්ත පිටපත් කිරීමට අපි නිර්දේශ කරමු

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The bracketed text <1>backup your data</1> is not rendered correctly in the Sinhala translation. The Sinhala equivalent should maintain the formatting or adjust for Sinhala text direction if needed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: The formatting should be reviewed and adapted for Sinhala script. For example, if using bolding, ensure it displays properly.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are inconsistent between the English and Slovak versions. The English uses <1> and </1> while the Slovak uses <1> and </1>. While the content is the same, maintaining consistent HTML tags is preferred.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change the Slovak HTML tags from <1> and </1> to <1> and </1> to match the English version.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The formatting tags <1> and </1> are inconsistent between the English and Ukrainian versions. The English version uses <1> and </1>, while the Ukrainian version uses the same tag.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent formatting tags across both languages. Use '<1>' and '</1>' in the Ukrainian version to match the English.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "các tính năng chỉnh sửa" is a literal translation of "editors" and doesn't convey the intended meaning of the English text. It's too technical and might confuse the user. It should be rephrased to something more user-friendly.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Thay đổi thành "nhân viên chỉnh sửa" or simply "chúng tôi" or "đội ngũ" to refer to the editors in a more natural way.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The formatting tag `<1>backup your data</1>` is preserved in the Vietnamese translation. This is not standard practice and needs to be removed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the formatting tags.  The backup instruction itself is fine.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "进行更新" (jin xing geng xin) after "开始" (kaishi) is redundant and sounds unnatural. It literally means "to carry out an update".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 请注意，在升级期间，编辑器将不可用。我们还建议您在开始之前<1>备份您的数据</1>。
